intro: Euphrasia randii, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, and it grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Euphrasia randii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in areas with partial to full shade.
